org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.mongodb

Class MongoDBDialect

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.ogm.dialect.spi.BaseGridDialect
      • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.mongodb.MongoDBDialect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, BatchableGridDialect, IdentityColumnAwareGridDialect, OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect, QueryableGridDialect<MongoDBQueryDescriptor>, GridDialect, Service

    public class MongoDBDialect
extends BaseGridDialect
implements QueryableGridDialect<MongoDBQueryDescriptor>, BatchableGridDialect, IdentityColumnAwareGridDialect, OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect
    Each Tuple entry is stored as a property in a MongoDB document. Each association is stored in an association document containing three properties: - the association table name (optionally) - the RowKey column names and values - the tuples as an array of elements Associations can be stored as: - one MongoDB collection per association class. The collection name is prefixed. - one MongoDB collection for all associations (the association table name property in then used) - embed the collection info in the owning entity document is planned but not supported at the moment (OGM-177) Collection of embeddable are stored within the owning entity document under the unqualified collection role In MongoDB is possible to batch operations but only for the creation of new documents and only if they don't have invalid characters in the field name. If these conditions are not met, the MongoDB mechanism for batch operations is not going to be used.
    Author:
    Guillaume Scheibel <guillaume.scheibel@gmail.com>, Alan Fitton <alan at eth0.org.uk>, Emmanuel Bernard <emmanuel@hibernate.org>

      • createTuple

        public Tuple createTuple(EntityKey key,
                TupleContext tupleContext)
        Description copied from interface: GridDialect
        Creates a new tuple for the given entity key.

        Only invoked if no tuple is present yet for the given key. Implementations should not perform a round-trip to the datastore but rather return a transient instance. The OGM engine will invoke GridDialect.insertOrUpdateTuple(EntityKey, Tuple, TupleContext) subsequently.

        Columns in the tuple may represent properties of the corresponding entity as well as *-to-one associations to other entities. Implementations may choose to persist the latter e.g. in form of fields or as actual links/relationships to the element representing the associated entity. In case of multi-column keys, the corresponding association role for a given column can be obtained from the passed tuple context.

        Specified by:
        createTuple in interface GridDialect
        Parameters:
        key - The tuple identifier
        tupleContext - Contains additional information that might be used to create the tuple
        Returns:
        the created tuple

                       TupleContext tupleContext)

        Specified by:

      • updateTupleWithOptimisticLock

        public boolean updateTupleWithOptimisticLock(EntityKey entityKey,
                                    Tuple oldLockState,
                                    Tuple tuple,
                                    TupleContext tupleContext)
        Description copied from interface: OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect
        Updates the given tuple. Implementors are expected to perform the update only if the entity has the given old version in the datastore. Specifically, atomic "find and update" semantics should be applied.
        Specified by:
        updateTupleWithOptimisticLock in interface OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect
        Parameters:
        entityKey - The key of the entity to save
        oldLockState - A tuple with all those column values identifying the previous version of the record in the datastore. Implementations are expected to apply all the contained columns to select the record to be updated.
        tuple - The entity column values to save
        tupleContext - Provides additional meta-data useful for the tuple update
        Returns:
        true if the update succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. if the entity has been updated in the datastore in parallel, so it has a newer version then the given one).

      • insertTuple

        public void insertTuple(EntityKeyMetadata entityKeyMetadata,
               Tuple tuple,
               TupleContext tupleContext)
        Description copied from interface: IdentityColumnAwareGridDialect
        Inserts the given tuple into the datastore, generating an id while doing so. The generated id is to be added to the given tuple (the id column name(s) can be obtained from the given entity key meta-data).
        Specified by:
        insertTuple in interface IdentityColumnAwareGridDialect
        Parameters:
        entityKeyMetadata - The type of the entity to save
        tuple - The entity column values to save
        tupleContext - Provides additional meta-data useful for tuple insertion

      • removeTupleWithOptimisticLock

        public boolean removeTupleWithOptimisticLock(EntityKey entityKey,
                                    Tuple oldLockState,
                                    TupleContext tupleContext)
        Description copied from interface: OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect
        Removes the given tuple. Implementors are expected to perform the delete only if the entity has the given old version in the datastore. Specifically, atomic "find and delete" semantics should be applied.
        Specified by:
        removeTupleWithOptimisticLock in interface OptimisticLockingAwareGridDialect
        Parameters:
        entityKey - The key of the entity to save
        oldLockState - A tuple with all those column values identifying the previous version of the record in the datastore. Implementations are expected to apply all the contained columns to select the record to be removed.
        tupleContext - Provides additional meta-data useful for the tuple removal
        Returns:
        true if the deletion succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. if the entity has been removed or updated in the datastore in parallel, so it has a newer version then the given one).

        Description copied from interface: GridDialect

The OGM engine will invoke GridDialect.insertOrUpdateAssociation(AssociationKey, Association, AssociationContext) subsequently.

      • isStoredInEntityStructure

        public boolean isStoredInEntityStructure(AssociationKeyMetadata associationKeyMetadata,
                                AssociationTypeContext associationTypeContext)
        Description copied from interface: GridDialect
        Whether the specified association is stored within an entity structure or not. E.g. dialects for document stores may support storing associations within entity documents and would have to return true if this is the case for a given association.
        Specified by:
        isStoredInEntityStructure in interface GridDialect
        Parameters:
        associationKeyMetadata - identifies the association of interest
        associationTypeContext - provides additional contextual information about the represented association type, such as the options effectively applying for it
        Returns:
        true if the specified association is stored within an entity structure, false otherwise.
